text: The 2001 Sacramento State Hornets football team represented Sacramento State UniversityThe official name of Sacramento State has been California State University, Sacramento since 1972. However, it is still commonly known as Sacramento State. during the 2001 NCAA Division I-AA football season. Sacramento State competed in the Big Sky Conference. The Hornets were led by seventh-year head coach John Volek and played home games at Hornet Stadium in Sacramento, California. They finished the season with a record of two wins and nine losses (2–9, 1–6 Big Sky). Sacramento State outscored its opponents 249–424 for the season. ==Schedule== ==Team players in the NFL== No Sacramento State players were selected in the 2002 NFL Draft. ==Notes== ==References== Sacramento State Category:Sacramento State Hornets football seasons Sacramento State Hornets football
title: 2001 Sacramento State Hornets football team
